intro: Coccoloba berazainiae, commonly known as the Berazain's lacandonia, is a rare species of shrub native to the Yucatán Peninsula in Mexico. It belongs to the Polygonaceae family, which includes plants known for their distinctive leaf structures and often edible fruits. The plant is characterized by its palmate leaves, which are divided into five to seven lobes, giving it a unique and striking appearance. It thrives in humid, tropical environments and is often found in limestone soils. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a vulnerable species.
